wikipedia_page.main: Richard Bradshaw was an English professional footballer. He played for Blackpool, his only professional club, between 1908 and 1911. The Padiham-born player made 29 Football League appearances for the Seasiders.

response: *Richard Bradshaw (fl. 1900s) footballer born in Padiham, played for Blackpool F.C.
*Richard Bradshaw (conductor) (1944–2007), British opera conductor and General Director of the Canadian Opera Company
* Richard Bradshaw, 17th century Ambassador of the Kingdom of England to Russia
*Richard Bradshaw (British Army officer) (1920–1999), Director General Army Medical Services, 1977–1981
